headline: Sweet Deviled Eggs
description: Try these sweet deviled eggs with just a bit more sugar than normally used in classic deviled eggs. You'll be pleasantly surprised with the taste!
name: Sweet Deviled Eggs

recipeInstructions.text: Place eggs in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil, then remove from then heat and let stand in hot water for 15 minutes. Transfer eggs to a bowl of ice water and let stand for 5 to 10 minutes.

Peel eggs, then slice in half lengthwise; set whites aside. Place yolks into a bowl and mash with a fork or pastry blender until powdery. Stir in mayonnaise, sugar, honey mustard, vinegar, salt, and pepper until well combined.
Spoon or pipe yolk mixture into halved egg whites. Arrange on a plate and lightly sprinkle with paprika. Chill for 20 to 30 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: I think it tasted great, I'm not really sure why there's a rating system for this cuz taste varies from person to person, but personally I enjoyed the sweeter version better than the original

As many of the reviews say, cut down the sugar and salt. I put in 2 teaspoons sugar and no salt and we really like it. At the very least, start out with less sugar and salt and you can add more as you like.
My son ate just about all of these before his daughter's birthday party. I guess he really liked these.
I just wasted 2 dozen farm fresh eggs and my time. I should’ve known not to stray from a good old fashioned recipe. Can’t explain the taste. All I can say is it just ain’t right.

We make these every Easter. Maybe a bit to sweet for my family as written, so I cut the sugar (and salt) in half and use mild Dijon mustard. Perfect amount of sweet for us. If you like your deviled eggs more sweet, these are perfect as written.
I did add the relish to the existing recipe, and Holy cow!!! Thank you for sharing!
they were super salty. I was highly disappointed.
Family loved it!
I enjoyed these, though I did end up adding yellow mustard and sweet pickle relish at the end.

Made just as written. Very good flavor. A bit runny, but firms up a little after refrigeration. A dash of hot sauce on top of half of them for a mix of flavors was a nice addition. I loved that they were sweet!
I also used pickle juice ... They came out Amazing!!!!!
Add just a little sugar at a time until the mix is to your satisfaction.
Great nit all that sweat relish I tripled it for Christmas
They came out great! Got a lot of compliments on them during Thanksgiving. I also added some hot sauce to half of the eggs and they were the first ones finished!
Delish! Doubled the recipe and it came out well. I would personally half the sugar, though everyone else liked it as it. Will definitely make it again.
Yummy but I might add a little less sugar next time since the honey mustard also adds some sweetness.
I used regular yellow mustard instead of honey mustard and these were delicious! Also added relish.
We loved these sweet deviled eggs. The only change I made to the recipe is to leave out the salt. We eat low sodium at our house. It still turned out delicious. Try 'em!!!
Easy to make and delicious! I didn’t have honey mustard and I left out the vinegar and it was still good. I used regular mustard. I hope to have all ingredients next time.
I will definitely make these again. A very good flavor. The best recipe that I have tried yet.
I'll probably add a bit more mayo next time. They were stiff and hard to pipe. Made for church and they were a hit, though!
good base recipe. I substituted relish in place of sugar. Also, after reading the previous reviews, I added salt and pepper to taste instead of the suggested serving
Way too sweet
I liked them, but just “so so” according to guests. Too sweet for our tastes.
Tasty, traditional flavor.

These were super yummy. I followed this recipe using 10 eggs and only adding a little more mayo. Otherwise the seasoning was perfect. Everyone at my party loved them and I’ll definitely make them again!
Loved them.
i absolutely loved these, BUT do not use honey mustard it makes it way to sweet. i also didn’t use paprika on top because i don’t do spicy stuff amdnit turned over very good.

We really liked this recipe, with a few modifications. I didn't use any sugar. I used honey instead. I also used regular mustard and think I used a little extra mayo (didn't really measure). I cut the amounts of salt, pepper, and vinegar in half. Lastly, I used apple cider vinegar instead of white vinegar. I will be making these again!
Way too salty! Was awful!

I loved this recipe but I made a few changes. I used a half teaspoon honey and one half teaspoon mustard. I did not add sugar. I used rice wine vinegar and 1 teaspoon worcestershire sauce. The hubby went nuts over it! This will be a favorite and the only deviled eggs recipe I use!
Very first time making this. My son and my husband loves it. Really sweet so if you'd prefer it to be less sweet use half the sugar. I will be making this dish from now on !
Enjoyed it! Brought this for someone's birthday at work and they absolutely loved it thanks!
Excellent! Only one caution. I have been on a no added salt diet for years so I reduced the salt by half. It was still too salty. Next time I will eliminate the salt entirely.
added jalapeno and sweet relish for person taste but otherwise great.
Very yummy!!!
Great flavor ! Will make again!
My family loved this recipe! I will be using again!!
I used this recipe as a base. I used yellow mustard and half as much salt and pepper. Then I added some chipotle hot sauce. WOW what a difference.

Delicious! These are not too sweet as written in the recipe. I did add less salt and pepper, but only because my husband gets really bad heartburn if he has too much. I love these eggs and will plan to make them again next Easter.

DON'T ADD THE AMOUNT OF SALT AND PEPPER that is called for in this recipe! My first batch of eggs were fed to my garbage disposal because of the overbearing salty taste. The second batch turned out well (I slowly added salt and pepper to taste).
Way too much salt and pepper! I love everything else in this except that. I would have done about 1/8 tsp of each.
A very pleasant variation.
I didn't make any changes and yes, I would definitely make them again. I forgot to serve them with dinner so we enjoyed them with dessert !
These were awful...the filling was runny, the taste was atrociously sweet...complete waste of time & ingredients...threw them out!
I always have to add a bit of sweet pickle relish
I just made for Thanksgiving! Looks and taste delicious! Easy to peel and make!! Thank you!
As others have commented this is too sweet. I would cut the sugar to 1 teaspoon and use Dijon mustard instead of honey mustard.
I made it exactly as the recipe stated and they were a big hit. I am now on permanent deviled egg duty for family gatherings. :)

I used 1/2 the sugar it called for.. a little less salt, I used miracle whip because I did not have mayonnaise, also used the honey mustard but I had some southwest honey mustard and decided to put a little of that in too.... that gave it the kick I was looking for..... It was still plenty sweet but NOT TOO...
deviled eggs are always a huge hit at my family gatherings. This recipe with added sugar was gone in a matter of minutes.
I've made these multiple times and they are always a hit! I didn't make any changes to the recipe. I used Hellman's mayo. Super yummy!
I made this and everyone raved about how great it was! I used all the required ingredients and I added sweet relish.
pretty tasty, i would reduce pepper by 1/2 though, it's pretty strong. but definitely will make this recipe again. super easy

I liked these a lot. Others thought they were too sweet. Next time cut down a little on both the salt and sugar and use smoked paprika instead of regular. Round 2: used half the called for amount of salt and sugar and tried smoked paprika. They were great. Do this again next time.
Great recipe. First time I'd made deviled eggs and they turned out perfectly.

My adult son loves these. I was fixing them so often that the last time I made them for him, I sent him home with the eggs and a copy of the recipe. I made the original recipe but I will try some of the suggestions listed here for a change up. Thanks so much
Leave out the sugar and use sweet pickle relish and liquid from relish to taste. Use regular mustard instead of honey mustard.
I thought the recipe was very good. If u try it try cutting back on the salt and pepper then taste because I thought that it was a little to much.
Super easy, super good. Used dijon mustard instead because its all i had but I would say overall hella freaking good, MF!
Best deviled eggs I've ever had.
Loved this sweet recipe for deviled eggs. The very best I have ever tasted!
family loves these
These were OK, be warned they are very sweet. A little too sweet for our taste however if you like really sweet eggs you may like these, we did not.
Being a Christian, I call them Angel Eggs. Very delicious recipe.

Great recipe, however I did make slight changes. I used spicy mustards & a Tsp of real honey. I also cut the tip off a 'New' Rx dispenser syringe & it was perfect for injecting each egg half with the mixture. I had very little left over & probably could've used it all but I don't like my eggs too stuffed. Again, delicious recipe! Highly recommend to try it for a something new twist on traditional deviled eggs :)

These were very good, but be warned: they are sweet. I made my own honey mustard and cut the salt in half. They were even better after they sat in the frig for a few hours. I really liked them, but husband asked where the pickle relish was :)
